gpt_university_description: Tallinn University of Technology, also known as TalTech, is the only technological university in Estonia. Established in 1918, TalTech is one of the flagship universities of the country, offering a wide range of science, engineering, and technology programs at the undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral levels. Its main campus is located in the capital city of Tallinn, with a strong emphasis on research, innovation, and entrepreneurship.
gpt_location_cost_of_living: The cost of living in Tallinn is generally considered affordable compared to other European cities. Rent, transportation, and groceries are relatively inexpensive, though nightlife and dining out can be pricey.
gpt_location_weather: Tallinn has a temperate maritime climate characterized by cold winters and mild summers. Temperature ranges from -6°C in January to 21°C in July. The city receives moderate rainfall, with snowfall common in the winter months.
gpt_location_description: Tallinn, the capital city of Estonia, offers a unique blend of medieval history and modern architecture. A UNESCO World Heritage site, Tallinn's Old Town boasts charming cobblestone streets, historic churches, and lively cafes. The city is also a growing hub for technology and innovation, attracting international companies and startups.
gpt_location_crime: Tallinn has a low crime rate compared to other European cities. Petty crime such as pickpocketing and theft can occur in crowded areas, especially in the tourist-heavy Old Town, but violent crime is rare. It is generally safe to walk around the city, but it is always advised to take precautions and stay vigilant.
gpt_location_transportation: Tallinn has an efficient public transportation system, comprising buses, trams, and trolleybuses. A single ticketing system, known as the Ühiskaart, is used across all modes of transport, and the city also offers a bike-sharing program for residents and visitors.
